caption: Republican members of Congress gather around House Speaker Mike Johnson after he signed President Donald Trump's signature domestic policy bill in Washington, DC, on Thursday, July 3.
author: Julia Demaree Nikhinson

caption: Beyoncé sits atop a prop car as it tilts in midair during a concert in Houston on Saturday, June 28. The singer was forced to temporarily stop the show after the red convertible prop, suspended by cables, began to list to the side during her song “16 Carriages.” Beyoncé was quickly lowered down without injury, according to her entertainment and management company.
author: Julian Dakdouk

caption: People celebrate in a fountain during the NYC Pride March in New York on Sunday, June 29.
author: Angelina Katsanis

caption: Karen Khachanov serves against Mackenzie McDonald during a first-round match at Wimbledon on Monday, June 30.
author: Ezra Shaw

caption: Firefighters work to extinguish a fire after shelling in the Russian-controlled Donetsk region of Ukraine on Monday, June 30.
author: Alexander Ermochenko

caption: Firefighters and community members watch as a procession carrying the bodies of fallen firefighters John Morrison and Frank Harwood passes under a bridge along Interstate 90 in Coeur d’Alene, Idaho, on Tuesday, July 1. The two men were fatally shot while responding to a brush fire on Canfield Mountain in what authorities described as a sniper attack. A third firefighter was also seriously injured in the shooting. The suspected gunman, 20-year-old Wess Roley, was found dead at the scene, apparently from a self-inflicted gunshot wound. He is believed to have started the fire so he could target the responding firefighters, officials said.
author: David Ryder

caption: Former journalist Lauren Sanchez and Amazon founder Jeff Bezos react during their wedding ceremony in Venice, Italy, on Friday, June 27. The couple celebrated their marriage on the Venetian island of San Giorgio Maggiore in front of some 200 high-profile guests, including Kim Kardashian, Oprah Winfrey and Leonardo DiCaprio. See more photos from the wedding.
author: @laurensanchezbezos

caption: Horseshoe Bend is seen in the Glen Canyon National Recreation Area near Page, Arizona, on Sunday, June 29.
author: Kaylee Greenlee

caption: A monk walks around the Tsuglagkhang, the Dalai Lama Temple complex, in Dharamshala, India, on Tuesday, July 1.
author: Anushree Fadnavis

caption: A pile of seized illegal drugs burns in Yangon, Myanmar, during a destruction ceremony marking the International Day against Drug Abuse and Illicit Trafficking on Thursday, June 26.
author: Sai Aung Main

caption: Lightning strikes near the National Mall in Washington, DC, on Tuesday, July 1.
author: Aaron Schwartz

caption: Los Angeles Dodgers pitcher Clayton Kershaw celebrates after recording his 3,000th career strikeout during a Major League Baseball game in Los Angeles on Wednesday, July 2. Kershaw joins Justin Verlander and Max Scherzer as the only active pitchers with that many strikeouts.
author: Ronald Martinez

caption: Workers arrange clay pots inside a kiln at a factory in Peshawar, Pakistan, on Wednesday, July 2.
author: Fayaz Aziz

caption: Dancers take part in the first night of the 44th annual Kamloopa Powwow in Kamloops, British Columbia, on Friday, June 27.
author: Marissa Tiel

caption: A Palestinian girl stands atop the rubble of a home that was destroyed by Israeli airstrikes in al-Zawayda, Gaza, on Tuesday, July 1.
author: Abdel Kareem Hana

caption: A bee-eater tries to eat a grasshopper in Konya, Turkey, on Saturday, June 28.
author: Yavuz Gorur

caption: The dome of the US Capitol is seen through traffic signals in Washington, DC, on Monday, June 30.
author: Nathan Howard

caption: Migrants board a boat on the coast of Équihen-Plage, France, in an attempt to cross the English Channel on Monday, June 30.
author: Sameer Al-Doumy

caption: Former US President Joe Biden pays his respects to Minnesota State Rep. Melissa Hortman and her husband, Mark, as they lie in state at the Minnesota Capitol Rotunda in St. Paul on Friday, June 27. The Hortmans, along with their golden retriever, Gilbert, were fatally shot in their home last month in what Gov. Tim Walz described as “a politically motivated assassination.”
author: Aaron Lavinsky

caption: Rapper and singer Doechii performs at the Glastonbury Festival in Somerset, England, on Saturday, June 28.
author: Oli Scarff

caption: Nikita Fedotov competes in the Red Bull Cliff Diving World Series in Polignano a Mare, Italy, on Saturday, June 28.
author: Dean Treml

caption: Florida Gov. Ron DeSantis, left, joins President Donald Trump, second from left, and Secretary of Homeland Security Kristi Noem, right, on a tour of a migrant detention facility, dubbed “Alligator Alcatraz,” in Ochopee, Florida, on Tuesday, July 1. The detention, processing and deportation camp for undocumented migrants is situated in Florida’s Everglades, the vast expanse of marshes and swamps that covers much of the southern part of the state.
author: Andrew Caballero-Reynolds

caption: Firefighters and residents attempt to extinguish a wildfire in Izmir, Turkey, on Monday, June 30. More than 50,000 people have evacuated the area because of the wildfires.
author: Ahmet Ayberk Cimen

caption: A monitor broadcasts House Minority Leader Hakeem Jeffries as he speaks on the House floor in opposition of President Donald Trump’s sweeping domestic policy bill in Washington, DC, on Thursday, July 3. Jeffries spoke for nearly nine hours, setting the record for the longest floor speech in the modern history of the US House of Representatives.
author: Kent Nishimura

caption: Children splash in mud as they celebrate the start of the annual rice planting season in the Nepalese village of Jitpur Phedi on Sunday, June 29.
author: Prakash Mathema

caption: Racers take to the track during a preliminary heat of the T-Rex World Championship Races in Auburn, Washington, on Sunday, June 29.
author: Lindsey Wasson

caption: Law enforcement officers detain a demonstrator during an anti-government protest in Belgrade, Serbia, on Saturday, June 28. Thousands of protesters gathered to demand an early parliamentary election.
author: Marko Djurica

caption: An artisan dyes a Banarasi saree at his workshop in Varanasi, India, on Saturday, June 28.
author: Niharika Kulkarni

caption: Players from Paris Saint-Germain and Inter Miami battle for possession during a Club World Cup match in Atlanta on Sunday, June 29. PSG won the match 4-0.
author: Shaun Botterill

caption: Bryan Kohberger, charged in the fatal stabbings of four University of Idaho students, appears at the Ada County Courthouse for a change-of-plea hearing in Boise, Idaho, on Wednesday, July 2. Kohberger, who for 30 months insisted on his innocence, pleaded guilty to charges of burglary and first-degree murder Wednesday. The deal that allows him to avoid the death penalty.
author: Kyle Green

caption: People play on a field in Geneva, Switzerland, that was painted by the artist Saype on Monday, June 30.
author: Saype

caption: Defense attorneys for Sean "Diddy" Combs line up for a group photo outside a federal court in New York on Wednesday, June 2. Combs was found guilty by a federal jury on two counts of transportation to engage in prostitution, but he was acquitted of the most serious charges of racketeering conspiracy and sex trafficking. Each transportation charge carries a maximum prison sentence of 10 years. The judge in the case, Arun Subramanian, denied bail for Combs, who now awaits sentencing.
author: Yuki Iwamura

caption: Palestinians receive supplies after aid trucks enter through the Netzarim Corridor in Gaza on Thursday, June 26.
author: Ali Jadallah

caption: Kindergarteners participate in a flag-raising ceremony at a school in Hong Kong on Monday, June 30.
author: Tyrone Siu

caption: A Saint Bernard receives care ahead of the inauguration of the Barryland Museum and Park, which is dedicated to the dog breed in Martigny, Switzerland, on Thursday, June 26.
author: Fabrice Coffrini

caption: A polar bear cools off at the Pairi Daiza zoo in Brugelette, Belgium, on Wednesday, July 2. A marine heat wave in the Mediterranean Sea is combining with a powerful heat dome to cause Europe to swelter. See last week in 31 photos.
author: Nicolas Tucat
